metadata.title: CVE-2022-3099 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Use After Free in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0360.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-athena - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-gtk - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-gui-common - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-nox - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-runtime - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
vim-tiny - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
xxd - 2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.1.2269-1ubuntu5.17').
